content: will be easiest to m1l make 1 left pick up the bar between the stitch you just knit and the next stitch from front to back knit through the back of the stitch alternate in even numbered row increments for the flat portion body m1r make 1 right pick up the bar between the stitch you just knit and the next stitch from back to front knit into the front this stitch there are two body options for the top one with waist shaping and one without take care to make sure you are following the correct instructions p purl for the option you wish you work the top is intended to be fitted p2tog left leaning on the purl side purl decrease purl the next two sts together throughout so i recommend waist increases unless your waist and bust are about the same in that case i recommend working the top without waist rds - rounds increases rs - right side note that for either shaping option you can knit the body as long as you sl1 slip one st knitwise with yarn in back want but if you work waist shaping and want to elongate the body you should also adjust your waist increase rate to include more row between sl1pwyif slip 1 purlwise with yarn in front increase rounds in order to evenly distribute increases ssk slip slip knit a left leaning decrease slip one st knitwise slip one st purlwise knit both slipped stitches together through the back loop top with waist increases begin here only if you wish to work the waist increase option if you want to work the top without waist increases skip forward to the section titled top ssp right leaning on the purl side purl decrease slip 1 st knitwise slip another st knitwise return the two slipped sts to the left needle then purl those two sts together through the without waist increases back loop on smaller needles using a stretchy cast-on method i like the old norwegian/german twisted cast-on co 94 108 120 134 154 168 188 sm sm 194 210 212 sts join for working in the round making sure not to twist sts st -
